definition: to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose

sentences.english: Manchester United have won the top division title in England no less than 19 times.
sentences.chinese: 曼联在以往的英格兰顶级联赛中至少成功夺魁19次。

sentences.english: I do not dare wild hope China to win at one fell swoop, but hopes is peace.
sentences.chinese: 我不敢奢望中国一举夺魁，但更希望的是和平。

sentences.english: Whether you can come top depends on if you will study hard.
sentences.chinese: 一个人是否能夺魁，取决与他是否努力学习。

sentences.english: Who will prevail in a loaded Three-Point Contest field?
sentences.chinese: 谁将在竞争激烈的三分大赛中夺魁？

sentences.english: Solo himself was a three-time winner of the race.
sentences.chinese: 索罗本人则曾在大赛中三度夺魁。

sentences.english: He made a good showing in competition with acknowledged front-runners.
sentences.chinese: 他在同公认的最可能夺魁的人竞争时表现不凡。

sentences.english: I dare not to entertain wild hope China with one action the defloration , but what to even hope is a peace.
sentences.chinese: 我不敢奢望中国一举夺魁，但更希望的是和平。

sentences.english: Anyway, the host team seems to fight for the gold.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎么说主队好象是志在夺魁。

sentences.english: She took the first place at the 40th World Championship in 1989.
sentences.chinese: 在1989年40界世界乒乓球锦标赛上她一举夺魁。

definition: to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
to win the laurels/to pass an imperial examination/to win a championship

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
laurel/victory garland (in Greek and Western culture)
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
to snatch gold/to take first place in a competition
to win as a result of tenacious effort/to fight off tough competition
to win the top award/to come first in the examination rankings
to continue in a post/(to hold a post) several times in succession/(to win a title) in successive years/to stay at number one/to defend a championship
